segments.content: React 19 RCs' has been one of the main characters of this newsletter for the past year, so thereâ€™s not much more to say apart that it's officially stable, apart 2 new features: the pre-warming feature that delayed the release, and new React-DOM static APIs. Here's a good reminder of other features we already covered;
segments.sourceMdx: React 19 RCs' has been one of the main characters of this newsletter for the past year, so thereâ€™s not much more to say apart that it's officially stable, apart 2 new features: the pre-warming feature that delayed the release, and new React-DOM static APIs. Here's a good reminder of other features we already covered;

segments.content:
* Actions / Server Actions / `useActionState()`
* `<form>` + progressive enhancement compatible hooks
* `<Context>` instead of `<Context.Provider>`
* The `use()` hook
* Custom Elements
* Ref as standard props and ref callbacks cleanup functions
* Meta tags handling
* Resource preloading
* Better errors and hydration diff reporting
segments.sourceMdx:
- Actions / Server Actions / `useActionState()`
- `<form>` \+ progressive enhancement compatible hooks
- `<Context>` instead of `<Context.Provider>`
- The `use()` hook
- Custom Elements
- Ref as standard props and ref callbacks cleanup functions
- Meta tags handling
- Resource preloading
- Better errors and hydration diff reporting

segments.content:
* ğŸ’¸ [React Bricks â€“ the Visual CMS for React got more accessible with lower entry price and flexible pay-as-you-go options. Start for free!](https://www.reactbricks.com/?utm_source=twir\&utm_campaign=ql24)
* ğŸ“– [A new React Router tutorial](https://reactrouter.com/tutorials/address-book): It goes over most of the features youâ€™ll need in \~30 minutes
* ğŸ“œ [How React Compiler Performs on Real Code](https://www.developerway.com/posts/how-react-compiler-performs-on-real-code): Enabling the compiler on a real app led to same performance on initial load, and improved performance on interactions. But the compiler is not always able to fully optimize your existing code.
* ğŸ“œ [Ref Callbacks, React 19 and the Compiler](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/ref-callbacks-react-19-and-the-compiler): TkDodo looks into ref callbacks, which now have cleanup functions. When should they replace `useEffect` ?
* ğŸ“œ [Building Scalable Micro-Frontends with Next.js Multi Zones](https://techhub.iodigital.com/articles/building-scalable-micro-frontends-with-next-js-multi-zones): Being able to deploy independently is a major advantage for big teams, and it turns out itâ€™s not that complicated with Next.js
* ğŸ“œ [Root Element API in waku](https://waku.gg/blog/root-element-api): Customize `<html>`, `<body>` and `<head>` in a `\_root.tsx` file
* ğŸ“œ [Multi-framework docs with Astro Starlight](https://blog.arcjet.com/multi-framework-docs-with-astro-starlight/)
* ğŸ“œ [SSR is not expensive](https://t3.gg/blog/post/ssr-is-not-expensive)
* ğŸ“œ [Reflections on managing state](https://www.frontendundefined.com/posts/monthly/react-state-management-reflections/)
* ğŸ“¦ [Next.js 15.1](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-15-1): React 19 stable, improved error debugging, `after` (to run code after the response is sent, eg for analytics) is stable, and new experimental `forbidden` and `unauthorized` APIs that work like `notFound`
* ğŸ“¦ [Restyle 3.0](https://www.restyle.dev/): A very lightweight CSS-in-JS lib for React which uses the new React 19 metadata APIs
* ğŸ“¦ [Lingui 5.0](https://lingui.dev/blog/2024/11/28/announcing-lingui-5.0): Support for RSC and a new `useLingui` macro among other improvements.
* ğŸ“¦ [react-render-stream-testing-library 2.0](https://github.com/testing-library/react-render-stream-testing-library/releases/tag/v2.0.0): No major new features, some breaking changes were necessary to be compatible with React 19

segments.content: Stream's Video React SDK empowers developers to integrate video calls, conferencing, and livestreaming with ease.
segments.sourceMdx: Stream's Video React SDK empowers developers to integrate video calls, conferencing, and livestreaming with ease.

segments.content: âœ”ï¸ **By Developers for Developers:** Fully customizable UI components and hooks, comprehensive documentation, and quickstart templates.
segments.sourceMdx: âœ”ï¸ **By Developers for Developers:** Fully customizable UI components and hooks, comprehensive documentation, and quickstart templates.

segments.content: âœ”ï¸ **Blazing-Fast Performance:** Sub-200ms latency and WebRTC-powered scalability.
segments.sourceMdx: âœ”ï¸ **Blazing-Fast Performance:** Sub-200ms latency and WebRTC-powered scalability.

segments.content: âœ”ï¸ **Out-of-the-Box Features:** Group calls, screen sharing, and adaptive bitrate, codecs, etc.

segments.content: The State of React Native 2024 survey is live! ğŸ“Š This is your chance to influence the future of React Native by sharing insights on trends, tools, and challenges. Your feedback helps guide the Expo and Meta teams in shaping improvements each year, benefiting the entire community.
segments.sourceMdx: The State of React Native 2024 survey is live\! ğŸ“Š This is your chance to influence the future of React Native by sharing insights on trends, tools, and challenges. Your feedback helps guide the Expo and Meta teams in shaping improvements each year, benefiting the entire community.

segments.content:
* ğŸ’¸ [React Native Mastery - Now open for enrollment!](https://notjust.dev/react-native-mastery?utm_source=twir\&utm_medium=email)
* ğŸ¦ [RN Unistyles v3 supports scoped theme](https://x.com/jpudysz/status/1865460854717632737): A missing feature since the removal of `UnistylesTheme` in v2.
* ğŸ“œ [The real-world impact of Shared Objects in Expo Modules](https://expo.dev/blog/the-real-world-impact-of-shared-objects): Shared Objects in Expo Modules enable seamless integration between native and JavaScript, improving API design and cross-package compatibility.
* ğŸ“œ [Introducing Uniffi for React Native: Rust-Powered Turbo Modules](https://hacks.mozilla.org/2024/12/introducing-uniffi-for-react-native-rust-powered-turbo-modules/): Uniffi for React Native integrates Rust with Turbo Modules, unlocking the entire Rust crates ecosystem for React Native apps.
* ğŸ“œ [Automated EAS Updates in a bare React Native app with Multiple Flavors & Schemes](https://shift.infinite.red/automated-eas-updates-in-a-bare-react-native-app-with-multiple-flavors-schemes-dcdf17963079): An article perfectly timed for projects that donâ€™t use Expo or EAS but rely on CodePush, and are in need of an OTA update solution before CodePush is officially sunset.
* ğŸ“œ [Developing a React Native TV App](https://www.callstack.com/blog/developing-a-react-native-tv-app)
* ğŸ“¦ [React Native Sheet Transitions - Beautiful universal sheet transitions](https://github.com/saulamsal/react-native-sheet-transitions): Looks impressive, but still in active development.
* ğŸ“¦ [@lingui/metro-transformer](https://lingui.dev/blog/2024/11/20/metro-transformer): Eliminates the need to precompile `.po` translation files by handling compilation during Metro bundling.
* ğŸ“¦ [React Native Fast IO pre-release](https://github.com/callstackincubator/react-native-fast-io): High-performance I/O solution for React Native, implementing standard W3C APIs like WebSocket, Fetch, FileSystem, Blob, and Streams, powered by Nitro.
* ğŸ“¦ [React Native Bottom Tabs v0.7.2 - macOS support, support for sidebars](https://github.com/okwasniewski/react-native-bottom-tabs/releases/tag/react-native-bottom-tabs%400.7.2)
* ğŸ“¦ [React Native Video Player v0.15](https://github.com/TheWidlarzGroup/react-native-video-player/releases/tag/v0.15.0)
* ğŸ¥ [A live demo of Radon IDE: the VS Code extension for streamlining development](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UeYmRKWhwFI)
* ğŸ™ï¸ [RNR 316 - Debugging the Debugger with Cedric van Putten and Alex Hunt](https://reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-316-debugging-the-debugger-with-cedric-van-putten-and-alex-hunt)

segments.content:
* ğŸ“œ [TC39 105th meeting](https://dev.to/hemanth/updates-from-the-105th-tc39-meeting-3gkh): several ES proposals progressed this week including Intl.DurationFormat, Immutable ArrayBuffer, Import Sync and more.
* ğŸ“œ [Airtable - Scaling TypeScript to thousands of projects](https://medium.com/airtable-eng/a-leap-in-the-evolution-of-airtables-codebase-scaling-typescript-to-thousands-of-projects-734326c3a553)
* ğŸ“œ [Node.js Delivers First LTS with require(esm) Enabled, Enhances Security and Release Automation](https://socket.dev/blog/node-js-delivers-first-lts-with-require-esm-enabled)
* ğŸ“œ [Solving NÂ² Complexity with JavaScript Maps](https://davidbonan.io/blog/solving-n2-complexity-with-javascript-maps)
* ğŸ“œ [CSS Wrapped 2024](https://chrome.dev/css-wrapped-2024/)
* ğŸ“œ [How to improve your page load time with browser caching | DebugBear](https://www.debugbear.com/blog/browser-caching)
* ğŸ“œ [Exploring Node.js Readable Streams](https://pavel-romanov.com/exploring-the-core-concepts-of-nodejs-readable-streams)
* ğŸ“¦ [OpenAuth - Universal, standards-based auth provider](https://openauth.js.org/)
* ğŸ“¦ [Dioxus 0.6 - Rust fullstack cross-platform app framework](https://dioxuslabs.com/blog/release-060): Looks like it's taking a lot of inspiration from React, and this large release adds many things such as Server Functions, SSG/ISG, Streaming HTML and much more.
